main event: A civilian reported a bright, shiny round object moving at high altitude near Aldan, Michigan on August 15, 1965.
interesting points: The observed object was described as moving in a straight path from horizon to horizon., The object was concluded to probably be a weather balloon based on physical descriptions., There were a number of similar reports that indicated a broader issue for the USAF., The report mentions that no radar evidence was available for the night of the sightings., Photographic evidence of a related object was mentioned, suggesting further investigation.
